meanings.definition: The quality of being reserved or reticent in speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her reservedness made it difficult for others to get to know her.
meanings.sent2: His reservedness often made people think he was shy.
meanings.sent3: Despite her reservedness, she had a great sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The reservedness of the old library gave it an air of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The reservedness of the cat added to its air of elegance.

meanings.definition: The state of holding back or keeping to oneself.
meanings.sent1: His reservedness in sharing his thoughts sometimes made him seem distant.
meanings.sent2: The reservedness of the student made it hard for the teacher to gauge their understanding.
meanings.sent3: The reservedness of the squirrel in sharing its nuts was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The reservedness of the ocean before a storm is a warning sign to sailors.
meanings.sent5: The reservedness of the mountain held untold stories within its rocky layers.
